sen.j: 藤原璋子近臣家の出身だったが、従兄弟には鳥羽法皇第一の寵臣・藤原家成がいたことから藤原得子ともつながりがあった。
sen.e: She was from the family of a trusted vassal of FUJIWARA no Shoshi and was also close to FUJIWARA no Tokushi (or Nariko) because FUJIWARA no Ienari, her cousin, was the most favorite retainer of the Cloistered Emperor Toba.

sen.j: その幅広い人脈により「夫ノ忠盛ヲモモタヘタル者（夫の忠盛をも支えるほどの者）」（『愚管抄』）と呼ばれ、忠盛の妻たちの中で最も重んじられていた。
sen.e: Because of her wide personal connections, she was called 'quite something who even supports her husband Tadanori,' ("Gukansho" (Jottings of a Fool)) and was respected most highly among his wives.

sen.j: 仁平3年（1153年）、夫が死去すると出家し、六波羅の池殿で暮らしたことから池禅尼と呼ばれた。
sen.e: When her husband died in 1153, she became a priestess and was called Ike no zenni because she lived at Rokuhara Ikedono.

sen.j: 保元元年（1156年）、鳥羽法皇崩御により保元の乱が勃発すると、忠盛・禅尼が重仁親王を後見する立場にあったことから平氏一門は難しい立場に立たされた。
sen.e: When the Hogen War happened in 1156 after the death of the Cloistered Emperor Toba, the Taira clan was put in a difficult situation because Tadanori and Zenni were guardians of the Imperial Prince Shigehito.

sen.j: 禅尼は、下記の通り、崇徳方の敗北を予測した。
sen.e: Zenni foresaw the defeat of the Sutoku side as 'in this war the newly retired emperor's side will certainly lose. There is no way to win.,' and ordered Yorimori to 'join forces of your brother Kiyomori surely' ("Gukansho").

sen.j: 「コノ事ハ一定新院ノ御方ハマケナンズ。」
sen.e: In this war the newly retired emperor's side will be certain to lose.'

sen.j: そして頼盛に「ヒシト兄ノ清盛ニツキテアレ」協力することを命じた（『愚管抄』）。
sen.e: And she ordered Yorimori to 'be sure to join the forces of your brother Kiyomori' ("Gukansho").

sen.j: この決断により平氏は一族の分裂を回避し、今まで築き上げてきた勢力を保持することに成功した。
sen.e: By this decision, the Taira clan could avoid the split among the clan and made a success to keep the power which had been built so far.
By this decision, the Taira clan could avoid the split among the clans and made success in keeping the power which had been built up so far.

sen.j: 平治元年（1159年）の平治の乱においては複雑な政争を勝ち抜いた継子平清盛が勝利し、その結果源義朝らの他の軍事貴族が駆逐された。
sen.e: In the Heiji War in 1159, her stepson TAIRA no Kiyomori, who had survived in the complicated political fight, gained a victory, and as a result, other military aristocracies such as MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo were ejected.

sen.j: 翌永暦元年（1160年）2月源義朝の嫡子で13歳の源頼朝が池禅尼ならびに頼盛の郎党である平宗清に捕えられた。
sen.e: On February 1160, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the legitimate son of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, who was thirteen years old, was captured by TAIRA no Munekiyo, who was a roto (retainer) of Ike no zenni and Yorimori.

In March 1160, the following year, the 13-year-old MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the heir of MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, was captured by TAIRA no Munekiyo, who was a roto (retainer) of Ike no Zenni and Yorimori.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: この際池禅尼は清盛に対して助命を嘆願したと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that Ike no zenni begged Kiyomori for mercy.

sen.j: また頼朝の助命の為に池禅尼が断食をし始めたため、遂に折れて伊豆国への流罪へと減刑したとも言われている。
sen.e: Besides, it is also said that Kiyomori gave in finally and commuted to an exile to the Izu Province because Ike no zenni had begun to fast in order to beg for Yoritomo's life.

sen.j: 上記内容を記している『平治物語』では、頼朝が早世した我が子家盛に生き写しだったことから宗子が助命に奔走したとするが、実際には頼朝が仕えていた統子内親王（待賢門院の娘、後白河の同母姉）や同じ待賢門院近臣家の熱田宮司家（頼朝の母方の親族）の働きかけによるものと推測される(元木泰雄『保元・平治の乱を読み直す』)。
sen.e: In the "Heiji monogatari" (The tale of the Heiji) which recorded above, it is described that Muneko desperately beg for Yoritomo's life because he was the spitting image of her son Iemori who had died early, but actually it can be guessed that it was caused by the approaches of the Imperial Princess Muneko (a daughter of Taikenmonin, a real sister of the retired Emperor Goshirakawa) and the Atsuta-guji clan, a trusted vassal of the Taikenmonin, (the family of Yoritomo's mother).

sen.j: その後、池禅尼は死去したと言われているが、正確な没年は不明である。

sen.j: 頼朝は池禅尼の恩を忘れず、伊豆国で挙兵した後も彼女の息子である頼盛を優遇し、平氏滅亡後も頼盛の一族は存続する。
sen.e: Yoritomo did not forget the kindness of Ike no zenni and gave preferential treatment to her son Yorimori after Yoritomo had raised an army in the Izu Province, and consequently, the family of Yorimori survived even after the fall of the Taira clan.
